Credit Line: Brooklyn Museum Costume Collection at The Metropolitan Museum of Art, Gift of the Brooklyn Museum, 2009; Gift of Mrs. Robert G. Olmsted and Constable MacCracken, 1969
Heilbrunn Timeline of Art History: The United States and Canada, 1900 A.D.â€“present
Description: The visual presence of this dress is quite stunning.  The combination of the lime green georgette and metallic embroidery is simply eye-catching.  The 1920s created a new sense of style, introducing a new tubular silhouette and a shorter skirt.  This new look promoted a more modern, independent woman.  This dress is a wonderful representation of that new freedom, as seen through the detailed design.
